---
title: "Resources"
---

* The `torch` website: [https://torch.mlverse.org/](https://torch.mlverse.org/docs/)
* The `torch` package website: [https://torch.mlverse.org/docs/](https://torch.mlverse.org/)
* Book by Sigrid Keydana: [Deep Learning and Scientific Computing with R torch](https://skeydan.github.io/Deep-Learning-and-Scientific-Computing-with-R-torch/) on which part of this is based.
* `mlr3torch` package website: [https://mlr3torch.mlr-org.com/](https://mlr3torch.mlr-org.com/)
* `mlr3` book: [https://mlr3book.mlr-org.com/](https://mlr3book.mlr-org.com/)
* `mlr3` website: [https://mlr-org.com/](https://mlr-org.com/)
* Since `torch` mimics `PyTorch` and the latter has a larger community, you can often learn from the [PyTorch documentation](https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/index.html).
